page.title: 07LOCAL CUSTOMS IN VENTNOR.
page.content: Ventnor Carnival is the second oldest in the country. Carnival week is the third week in August and there are two processions, one illuminated. The Carnival Queen leads the procession from Albert Street to the Park. Many floats and bands take part. The first week-long Smuggling Pageant was held four years ago to remind people of the local connection with smuggling. Many people wear 19th century costume for a week. There are encounters between smugglers and militia men and other related events. The Crab Fayre was held on a site near the Crab and Lobster Inn many years ago. It sold mainly crabs caught locally. In 1976 the Lions Club revived the Fayre at the Botanic Gardens. It takes place on Spring Bank Holiday Monday.
